intro: Spyridium stenophyllum subsp. renovatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The species is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. This subspecies is notable for its ability to thrive in dry conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
